title: How do we know what really happened in history? What if the government is lying to us? - Quora

response.answer_text: The government doesn't determine what it is written about history. Historians do. They get their information from all sorts of places, government and non-government, and try to arrive at something close to the truth. Not to say the government hasn't lied in the past, but particularly in the US – the truth tends to come out sooner or later. There is usually a paper trail or a money trail.
Does the government document everything about everything? No. (I’ve also removed two of the topics because the world doesn’t revolve around ‘Murrica. There are other countries you know).
Ilan Elron's answer to Could history have been fudged up along the way during its creation or do you believe everything historically happened exactly as documented?
